description:

*Get the HiiTS Driver for 10% OFF with code MILO ðŸ‘‰ http://hiitsgolf.com/milo*

In this episode "Fast" Eddie Fernandes walks us through the exact protocol he used to become a 3x World Long Drive champion, plus reveals his HiiTS Speed Training Driver. After testing, we truly believe this is the absolute best (and safest) way to increase swing speed and distance. 

While sticks can help, through our years of coaching we've come to the realization that there is a greater risk for injury, and the speed found in training sessions just doesn't seem to transfer as well to the golf course. Basically, it just doesn't stick, and those all-out air swings could only be making your swing and ball striking worse. We've discovered that hitting balls is actually best and we commend Eddie on putting together this first class product and training aid. We really think golfers are going to love it!

title: PLEASE Stop Hitting At The Golf Ball! (Sam Snead Says Hit Through It Like This)
description:
Ever wonder how the truly great ball strikers really hit a golf ball? Well fortunately some of the legends have left clues, like Sam Snead. He says, "You don't hit at the golf ball, you hit through it." In this video, we'll show you what he means and how to create better contact shot-after-shot for yourself.

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

Milo Lines Golf coach, Henry Fall joins me in encouraging you to please stop hitting AT the golf ball once and for all. For those of you tired of hitting behind the golf ball, if you really want to end the frustrating chunks, thins and tops, the real magic lies in Sam Snead's effortless move and simple words â€“ you hit THROUGH it. This is how to a hit a golf ball and really compress it! We hope you enjoy this special episode.

title: How To Turn Your Chest OPEN And Not Swing Over The Top!
description:
So you're wanting to get open, but maybe every time you try to turn, you swing over the top? In today's video, my assistant Henry Fall joins me to give you the golden ticket to chest rotation on plane and still from the inside! All for a more efficient golf swing and better ball striking. 

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

While some may say you should resist and hold your back to the target, my opinion is that chest rotation is both healthy and natural. Plus, your swing plane will thank you. It also aligns with other sports. You would always open your chest when throwing a ball, swinging a bat, or delivering a forehand in tennis â€“ so why not in the golf swing?

The best in the world are getting their chest open at impact, turning freely in their bends, so now let's show you how you can too... All without getting steep and swinging over the top! We hope you enjoy this episode and we look forward to hearing how it helped and your feedback.

title: I Shut OFF His Right Arm To Transform His Ball Striking! (LIVE Golf Lesson)
description:
Gary showed up battling his golf swing all through the bag. The main culprit? His right arm! In this live golf lesson, see the steps we took to shut it off, and in the process transform his ball striking for the better. 

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

By limiting the role of the right arm, Gary improved structure, simplified his swing, and unlocked effortless power and accuracy. His right arm like so many was getting trapped behind him. I see this pattern every day on the lesson tee. Golfers so badly want to pull the trail arm (and right elbow) back behind the seam line in the backswing. It gets you stuck and makes the golf swing much more complicated. Through better grip, chest rotation, and arm positioning, (by the end) Gary discovered crisper contact, straighter shots, and more distanceâ€”especially with the driver. Watch his transformation and learn how to minimize right arm involvement so you can improve your swing too!

title: How To Quit Rolling The Golf Club For Good! (The Stable Method)
description:
Are you tired of rolling your golf club, feeling the club face flip over, and seeing the ball go left? In this video, Henry Fall and I will share with you (what we believe to be) a more consistent, stable method to produce straighter shots and more reliable ball striking! 

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

For those of you who have been taught to open and close the door, and really twist the clubhead with forearm rotation, turning your wrists, and rolling your hands to "release" and "square" the face â€“ I'm here to tell you I believe there is a better way! 

What if the "roll" should be thought of as more of a natural byproduct? Maybe it's not something we necessarily should be trying to do? In this episode, you'll see the approach I like to take, something we cover further in The Athlete's SwingÂ®. Plus, we'll give you a few simple drills to bring about a more stable golf swing for yourself! We look forward to your feedback...

title: He Ended Years Of Pulling Down By Feeling Passive Arms! (LIVE Golf Lesson)
description:
Adrian is back to clean up his longtime tendency to pull down his arms to start the downswing. Watch as he quickly dials in a more passive approach for better ball striking! 

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

So many amateurs and even pros I coach struggle with pulling down from the top, leading to a rushed transition and often quick, jerky downswing. This often leads to issues with club path, face angle, and ball first contact. While the hands and arms 100% have a place and are active, this pull can be (and often is) overdone... I hope you enjoy seeing the progress Adrian made in this live golf lesson, and you too can learn from these trainings to develop a more systematic golf swing for yourself.

title: Unlock ROTATION In Your Golf Swing With This #1 KEY!
description:
*See the missing 4 KEYS now...* https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/

For so many golfers rotation is feared. Many believe it will cause you to only get steep and come over-the-top. But I'm here to tell you that doesn't have to be the case! In fact, rotation done correctly can lead to more speed and power, better contact, more compression, and (perhaps best of all) freedom in your golf swing. Wouldn't you prefer own a more effortless golf swing! Legends like Ben Hogan, Lee Trevino, and Sam Snead didn't hold back and resist rotation, so why should you?

You'll also see in this 1st KEY that rotation doesn't start where you think. It seems everyone talks about hip rotation, but as you'll find out I believe the focus should be somewhere else...

Don't forget to watch the complete 5 KEYS to Rotation, as it's critical you understand the matchups you need to get more open at impact, and turn the right way! I call these my "non-negotiables". Henry and I will also share a few simple rotation drills you can put into practice right away. And in this video series you'll learn how a rotational golf swing could be the answer you've been looking for, to finally improve your ball striking and find more consistency in your game. You can watch (for FREE) the complete 5 KEYS to Rotation, here: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/.

title: Do The Hands And Arms Create The MOST Clubhead Speed? (My Test)
description:
How much clubhead speed really comes from the hands and arms? That's the question I'll look to answer in this test...
***Learn The Athlete's Swingâ„¢ HERE*** http://swinglikeanathlete.com

It's been often said that upwards of 80% or 90% of our clubhead speed comes from the hands and arms in the golf swing, but I've often seen it differently. That's not to say everyone is exactly the same. The argument has also long been to look at a golfer swinging from their knees as proof (a la Tiger Woods who I showcase in this video) because upwards of 80% clubhead speed can still be created this way. However, are the hands and arms truly exclusive in this exercise? Perhaps a higher % should be accounted for from other areas, such as the chest, ribcage, torso, and even a % from the pelvis, feet, and legs? Especially when standing...

Lastly, maybe the golf swing shouldn't always be boiled down into singular parts, but rather looked at, and thought of more systematically. I believe in creating a more athletic, global movement pattern for this reason, learning to wind up the system and unwind for best performance... Let's investigate!

title: How To Turn Off Your Arms For An Effortless Golf Swing!
description:
There's a lot of debate out there on the roll of the arms in the golf swing. For a more natural, athletic, and effortless move, here's my 2 cents... *Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

...in my opinion the arms should not be thought of as the power producer. To me it is a passive powering of the arms by the whole system (or body) that creates a true organic, athletic swing. Like we see in other sports, the hands and arms are not the sole producers of speed. They are more loose and springy, being stretched out for maximal speed. They are as I like to say, energized.

In this video I'll walk you through how I like to see the arms managed (especially in transition) and how I teach my students. For many I work with, tension in the arms, and over-activation of the arms robs them of so much speed and power. Flow also goes out the window. The swing becomes completely unnatural, stiff, and jerky. But with the right roadmap and understanding of athletic movement and sequence in general, I truly believe anyone can find a more natural move. And finally Swing Like an Athlete! I do hope you enjoy this episode and I look forward to your feedback.

title: How To Master The Power Fade With Driver (LIVE Golf Lesson)
description:
In this golf lesson, high-level player Adrian stopped in to better command his driver and learn the keys to the Tour preferred power fade!

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

For a long time Adrian really battled blocks and hooks as his swing had gotten tilty and driven by his hands. This led to the dreaded two-way miss, which we all know can be a killer! During our time together we really focused on getting him more stacked up, more rotational, and less reliant on his hands and arms. 

Over the course of a couple days we were able to make some great progress, getting his swing path and low point cleaned up through just a few consistent feels, and his swing became more effortless. In this episode, you'll get a glimpse of our time together where we focused on driver. In a short time we was able to start hitting a more reliable power fade for more control and freedom through the ball. I do hope you enjoy this lesson and look forward to your thoughts!

title: How To STOP Casting In Your Golf Swing Once And For All!
description:
Oof, casting...one of the most glaring differences between elite and poor ball strikers. Here's how to stop it and fix it for good!

***Get The Hanger Training Aid for 15% OFF*** https://milolinesgolf.com/training-gear/

***Learn the steps to Swing Like an Athlete HERE*** http://swinglikeanathlete.com

In this video Henry and I will show you some easy to follow steps on how to stop casting in your golf swing once and for all...no more cast and only tow! Casting in the downswing is no good, plain and simple. Those who command good ball striking (like Sam Snead and Patrick Cantlay as you'll see) are not throwing angles from the top, but rather conserving them (more or less) into the ball. This produces the compressed impact we all seek after, with some amount of shaft lean.

The same could be said for hitters in baseball or if you were to chop a tree. Angles are not thrown out with an early release but rather preserved, then let out more naturally later in the motion. And as you'll see in this episode, you'll learn to quit the cast and pass, and begin to load and tow! We hope you enjoy this one and look forward to your feedback.

title: This Magic Left Elbow Move Is The Best Ball Striking Tip I've Ever Received!
description:
This is perhaps the best ball striking tip I've ever received! Aligning and moving the left elbow like this was a game-changer.

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Milo's full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

I was very fortunate starting out in this game to have such a strong, impactful voice in my Dad. He gave me great fundamentals for my golf swing that correlated with my baseball roots. One of those key, I would consider, "magic" matchups was the left arm (or lead arm) and how the left hand grip, left elbow, arms and shoulder all aligned. I believe this created a sort of power line.

This position at the onset allowed me to swing just like I would in baseball, or when throwing a frisbee, or making similar athletic movements. While many instructions in the past (including Ben Hogan and his 5 lessons book) may have eluded to a more externally rotated lead arm at setup, video and photos of Mr. Hogan, and many other greats tend to show a more internally rotated lead arm as I point out in this video. To me this is a much more powerful structure and alignment, aligning with other sports, and allows you to truly swing and spring the lead arm versus forcing it. This also aligns with my general opposition of lowering and pulling down the arms to start the downswing, a move I generally see ruin a natural swing and arc.

I hope you enjoy this episode! Do give it a like if it helped, and leave a comment with your feedback, questions, or future video recommendations. Thanks!

title: The MAGIC MOVE To Start The Downswing With Your Lower Body!
description:
Time to unleash! Ed Lasater joins me to share the magic move you need to start the downswing with your lower body (just like the pros).

***Missing power in your strikes? Get my FREE compression booster*** https://milolinesgolf.com/compress

By learning to use the windup in the backswing to carry us into the downswing, the overall swing can become much more free and powerful, and as you'll see rotation can become easy! And what you'll also see in this video is that even if you have a shorter swing like Jon Rahm, or a longer swing like Jake Knapp, the pattern is still relatively the same. title: NEVER Keep Your Shoulders Closed At Impact! (TURN OPEN Like This)
description:
Have you been told to keep your shoulders closed at impact? In this video, we'll show you why it could be wrecking your swing!

***Join My Online Academy HERE*** https://milolinesgolf.com/online-academy/

In this episode, Henry joins me to discuss one of the most common matchups we see on the lesson tee, the closed off chest and shoulders position through impact. While the intention may be good to better deliver the golf club from the inside in the downswing, the results can be anything but positive. This is why we'd prefer see your shoulder turn actually get you a bit open through the strike.

And when you look at the best players in the world, and great ball strikers throughout history, they truly aren't "closed off". In fact, they are allowing themselves to unwind and get open through the hitting area. Why be restricted when you can freely, make an effortless turn through? So if you struggle with blocks, pulls, and hooks, plus hitting behind the ball, then this lesson may prove to be most helpful to you! We hope you enjoy and look forward to your feedback in the comments.

title: How To Pull The Handle In The Golf Swing (Like The Pros!)
description:
In this video, you'll learn the two most powerful ways to pull the handle in the golf swing, just like the pros!

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

One of the primary differences I see between PGA Tour pros and amateurs on my lesson tee is how they power the golf club out of the top of the swing. Do they muscle it, or do they swing it? This is a key distinction, and has a massive effect on contact, distance, and overall consistency.

In this episode, I will show you the two areas where you should be pulling on the handle or grip of the golf club. But, and this is a big but, it's not the pulling you're likely thinking of! It's not by yanking, firing, throwing, or tensing up...it's through a more systematic, body driven action. I hope you see the benefits of this tip, and if done properly, I know your ball striking will improve and your swing will feel more effortless!

title: When To Release The Golf Club For Maximum Speed (My Experiment)
description:
I decided to do an experiment to see how the timing of the release in the golf swing affects clubhead speed. Here's what I learned.

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

How we release the golf club is a hot topic, but not only that, it's important to discuss when we release. I've long been of the belief that the release in general should feel rather passive and that it should happen as more of a byproduct, with physics ultimately taking command. It is after all nearly impossible to truly hold wrist angles forever, especially at maximum speed.

In this episode I share with you my experiment using Trackman to determine which "release" style is most effective in producing the maximum speed for me. How you interpret my findings are ultimately up to you, but for me there was one apparent winner. I hope you enjoy and look forward to your feedback!

title: I Modeled My Golf Swing After David Duval And Instantly Saw Better Ball Striking! (Here's Why)
description:
After my baseball days ended and I picked up golf, here's how modeling my swing after David Duval helped improve my ball striking!

*Get My FREE 5 Keys to Rotation HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

In this video, we go back to 1999 when I was transitioning from my baseball playing career into golf. As part of this switch, I found myself fascinated by the great ball strikers of the past and present, and what they did so well. One person stood out to me and that was David Duval. I had the chance to watch him in person when he came to Phoenix that year and I was mesmerized by his game.

It was then I decided to further analyze David's golf swing and started to notice aspects of his action that paralleled my baseball swing. I picked up on his strong left land grip, his rotational move, the stable club face, and how his eyes and head followed the ball. These patterns were familiar to me, and for that reason I began using David as my sort of model. I hope you enjoyed this special episode and look forward to hearing from you on what you learned, and what golf swings you most admire and model after!

title: You'll Quit Stalling And Turn Through The Ball With This! (NONSTOP ROTATION)
description:
If you are sick and tired of feeling unable to turn through the ball, and your rotation is stalling, then I bet this video will be an eye-opener!

*Get My FREE 5 Keys to Rotation HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

It's time to get the energy out front and complete the corner! I work with students every day who struggle to turn, rotate, and open up. The lead side fails to get out of the way, with the lead hip and shoulder blocking the exit. There is a fear that rotation can be a bad thing, but I'm here to set the record straight and share with you that unwinding through the ball and past impact can be both natural, and ideal for power and efficiency!

Let's get the idea of hitting at the ball out of our minds and work on swinging through the ball, having the golf ball merely get in the way of our good movement! After all the target is the target, not the ball. You'll also get to see one of my favorite drills for rotation and to help practice these concepts. I hope you enjoy this episode and look forward to your feedback.

title: She Fixed Her Bowed Left Wrist For Straighter Irons! (LIVE Golf Lesson)
description:
Becca came by for a golf lesson before her final college tournament and we fixed her bowed left wrist. She left hitting higher, straighter irons!
***Access My FREE 5 Keys to Rotation*** https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

In this lesson, it was quickly evident that Becca's bowed left wrist was causing her face to get overly closed and de-lofted, leading to a low left miss with her irons. By neutralizing her wrist hinge and stabilizing the club face, she quickly was able to start hitting her irons higher again, with more spin, and with far less shots pulling to the left. 

While some players like a Collin Morikawa or Dustin Johnson may be able to make that pattern work, it's important to consider the student and ball flight characteristics, such as: height, spin, launch angle, land angle, start line, and curve. How they manage the club face and release is crucial in being able to match up their bow in the lead wrist. I hope you enjoy this live golf lesson and a look into the changes we made with Becca to better suit her game!

title: The ESSENTIAL Iron Shot That Separates Pros Vs Ams!
description:
It seems all the pros I know can hit this essential iron shot on command, yet ams I see every single day struggle with it ... but why??

â›½ï¸ðŸ”¥ *Miloâ€™s Favorite Drill to COMPRESS the Golf Ball: https://milolinesgolf.com/compress*

In our experience, most golfers struggle to produce a dynamic, pro-like impact. The strike is most often not compressed and the swing lacks the movements required to produce consistent ball striking, especially when hitting irons. By learning to execute this flighted iron shot we demonstrate in this video, golfers are then better able to train at lower speeds, control their ball flight, and produce a better impact position. And we label this iron shot as essential as we see the best players throughout history demonstrating this shot on a regular basis. Look no further than Jordan Spieth, Tommy Fleetwood, Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy, or Wyndham Clark for evidence of this crucial shot. And once mastered, you'll stop flipping at impact for sure!

We hope you enjoy this video and do encourage you to add this simple shot to your next practice session to springboard your ball striking. We look forward to your feedback!

title: Why You Shouldnâ€™t Drop Your Arms In The Downswing (Do This Instead!)
description:
Do you feel stuck in your golf swing, with your right elbow trapped? Maybe the easy fix is you shouldn't drop your arms in the downswing!

***Unlock a Rotational Golf Swing HERE*** https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/

This typically couples with an excessive in-to-out path and major low point issues! title: The Club Fitting SECRET Ben Hogan And Lee Trevino Used For Legendary Ball Striking
description:
Did Ben Hogan and Lee Trevino master this club fitting secret for legendary ball striking? Chad Dietz of Foreward Golf returns to reveal!

Find out more about Foreward Golf and Chad Dietz:
Website - https://www.foreward.golf/about-us
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/foreward.go...

In our 2nd episode with Chad from Foreward Golf we look at the clubs and classic movements presented in the Ben Hogan golf swing and Lee Trevino golf swing, and how they correlated for these two elite ball strikers. What you may not have known is that these two legends played somewhat similarly designed golf clubs, specially designed irons that we estimate 99% of golfers don't use today. For our discussions we focus on lie angle and sole design. What's more, these irons created a pathway, and essentially incentivized these great swingers to move in a particular rotational fashion. With this in mind, perhaps this should have been one of the Ben Hogan Five Lessons? We thank you for watching and look forward to your feedback!

description:

title: Jack Nicklaus Told Me This About RELEASING The Golf Club From The Top!
description:
I had the great fortune of meeting Mr. Jack Nicklaus about 15 years ago and asked him about releasing the golf club from the top.

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *[FREE] Unlock a Rotational Golf Swing with Milo's 5KEYS: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

Full quote from Jack Nicklaus: "It looks like I'm purposely delaying the release of the club. But I can assure you I never tried to delay the hit or retain my wrist cock. That happens naturally, if you start with a proper grip, maintain a light grip pressure and keep your arms relaxed. It's impossible to release the club too early in the downswing -- as long as you move to your left side and swing the club from inside the target line." It would appear there is more to the story than the old saying you should just release the golf club from the top, and in this video I'll break down my conversation with the Golden Bear, and my take on this meaningful subject. I hope you enjoy!

title: My Lesson With The CEO Of Golf Building A More Stable Swing
description:
It was great having the CEO of Golf, Remec Carlson stop by for a golf lesson to work on building a more stable swing! 

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

You'll notice in this training, we focused in on a couple thoughts to better control the club face and how it can align with a more rotational pattern. While Remec already had a very nice action, he was a little hindered in how much he could increase swing speed, take the governor off, and freely turn without losing control (especially with a driver). This forced him to slow down to keep the ball in play so he could still shoot a score. With a more stable pattern, now he can work towards speeding things up while also maintaining control in order to reduce that push slicing driver. title: DON'T Keep Your Back To The Target In The Downswing!
description:
Many golfers have been told to "keep your back to the target in the downswing", but is that the most optimal matchup? The feeling has certainly worked for many high level players, as demonstrated in this video by Justin Rose. That said, in my experience, professionals have a far superior pivot to begin with and what they "feel" isn't necessarily "real" in their swing. Depending on where they are in their golf swing journey, that feel could match up well for them. After all, elite golfers are typically just looking to find neutral to some extent. It's not my preference to see them keep their back to the target longer, but that matchup can and has worked for some. However, in my experience I don't believe it's the feel the majority of the golfing population should strive for, as there are numerous other factors that play into creating the over the top golf swing often associated with this potential solution. The question I pose to you in this video is, is there another way, and perhaps could another way be more functional and dynamic? I hope you enjoy, and as always, I welcome your thoughts!

title: This Is How To Hit A Driver Farther! (My Wrecking Ball Move To DEMOLISH)
description:

The driver swing can be a free flowing, dynamic movement. A little trigger to get you going is how it best starts, just like Dustin Johnson demonstrates in this video. title: This Makes Getting Open At Impact So EASY!
description:

title: Strike It Like A PRO With Hands Over Ankle At IMPACT!
description:
If you are struggling to compress the golf ball at impact like a pro, look no further and watch this video! 

â›½ï¸ðŸ”¥ *Miloâ€™s Favorite Drill to COMPRESS the Golf Ball: https://milolinesgolf.com/compress*

In this episode, Henry and I will walk you through the steps to creating a more dynamic golf impact position where the hands cover your lead ankle. In our coaching, we often see students that throw angles out from the top depriving themselves of distance and compression. The ball tends to go very high and not very far. In these cases we see their hands falling well behind the lead ankle at impact, essentially causing them to hit off their trail leg. This can create contact issues, loft issues (dynamic loft too high), and low point problems. Let's look at how we can get the ball going out instead. We hope you enjoy this video on producing a tour like impact!

title: How To Propel Your Left Arm In The Backswing (Straight And Wide)
description:
Learn how to propel your left arm in the backswing! 

***Miloâ€™s #1 Drill to COMPRESS the Golf Ball*** https://milolinesgolf.com/compress

In this video, Henry and I will help you through a common issue we see on the lesson tee, and that is the left arm in the golf swing, specifically the golf backswing, getting pulled in and across the chest early. 

This goes hand-in-hand with the right arm in a golf swing getting over-folding. This gets the hands really deep and typically correlates with a lack of wind-up and body turn in the backswing. From here, we often see the hand path shoot out to start the downswing and create an over-the-top pattern. 

We'll show you a better way to takeaway the golf club, wide and with a "straight" left arm. However, straight is another word we need be careful with. A straight left arm can cause people to get too tense and rigid, depriving them of potential swing speed and the dynamic sling you often hear us discuss on this channel. 

We'll show you the proper way to propel the arms in the golf swing without getting locked up. We hope you enjoy!

title: Golf Lesson: Stable Wrist Hinge And Release In 10 Minutes! (Part 2 LIVE)
description:
To conclude our two part lesson with Spencer, Henry and I further build on our first day's lesson by continuing to encourage a more dynamic athletic move. In this golf lesson, we focus more on the golf wrist hinge and how creating right wrist extension (to be released into wrist flexion) can be utilized for more power and a more stable club face angle throughout. For Spencer, the tendency was to get his right hand grip on the club too strong, causing him to tilt more coming into impact and resulting in low point control issues with his irons and wedges. Correcting his right hand grip, as was also seen in the first golf lesson was a key part in helping Spencer improve his ball striking. With this method, you will see far less roll of the club face, therefore producing a much more square golf swing release. With this wrist action established, Spencer could then turn on the jets and begin letting his more athletic swing loose! We hope you enjoy this episode.

title: SWAY The Ribcage In Your Golf Downswing Sequence To STACK And Turn w/ @elitegolfschoolsâ€‹
description:
As coaches, we regularly get asked how to start the golf downswing sequence. Let's go over it and how we can use our ribcage!

***Join My Online Academy HERE*** https://milolinesgolf.com/online-academy/

In this video with Elite Golf Schools, we'll uncover a move that we see happening during this transition and the beginnings of the golf downswing sequence, and that is the sway of the ribcage. This move which happens along with the pressure shift back to the lead side helps us stack up our centers (upper and lower), the torso and pelvis, so we can then turn into the ball with proper low point control, angle of attack, and path. Without this landing phase, turning or rotating only spins us out and can create a steep downswing. In addition to the rib sway early in the downswing, we'll also look at the rib sway early in the backswing and takeaway which helps create a proper wind up off the ball. We hope you enjoy this addition to our elite golf series!

title: HIGH To LOW Move To Start Turning And Stop Extending!
description:
Do you struggle to properly turn and rotate in your swing, and find yourself early extending? In this video I'll show you a different pattern to create flexion and rotation in transition and quiet down that standing up move in the downswing. You'll see how to start turning hips and stop thrusting them towards the ball! Many students I see lower early off the ball, turning in the wrong bends which sets them up to create a more over the top pattern. This often requires more squaring of the club face and early extension to help shallow out the golf club late into the strike. We also take a look at the Jon Rahm swing to see what impact elements he creates to become the top player he is. Let's learn this high to low move to spawn a more rotary golf swing where we can land in transition and turn the corner like the pros. I hope you enjoy this video!

title: How To DOWNSHIFT In Transition For A Powerful Transfer To Your Left Side
description:
Do you struggle to transfer pressure to your left side in transition? Let's fix that!

Shift like a pro! *Get your DownShift Board for 10% OFF: https://milolinesgolf.com/training-gear/*

In this video, Henry and I whip out the Downshift pressure board to demonstrate this important move to change directions athletically from your backswing to downswing. One of the main issues we find is that amateur golfers tend to move too far right in their backswing and struggle to get back to their lead side, as seen in our recent golf school with Dr. Scott Lynn and Swing Catalyst. 

This often results in a steep downswing, tilting, sliding, chunks, thins, etc. There also seems to be a misunderstanding between mass, weight and pressure. We will clear up the confusion between weight shift or weight transfer, and our preferred pressure shift move. And rather than just keeping weight on left side in golf swing, with help from the Downshift board, you will learn the key transition moves needed to sequence and transfer energy more efficiently in your golf swing! We hope you enjoy this episode.

title: Golf Lesson: He Used This Right Hand TRICK To Compress Irons 21 MORE YARDS!
description:
In this golf lesson with Jeremy, we mastered this simple right hand move to finally compress the golf ball!

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *Milo's 5 KEYS to a Rotational Golf Swing: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

We moved Jeremy not only to a strong golf grip, but encouraged a more stable clubface throughout the golf swing! This resulted in a more optimal push draw shape and far more distance! In just 30 minutes with the help of this right hand back to compress feel, he increased carry with his 7 iron from 154 yards to 175 yards...a 21 yard increase!

If you have long been following the Milo Lines Golf channel, you'll know one of the staples of my preferred rotational golf swing method is the trail or right hand and wrist position, and how right wrist hinge (wrist extension) can create a more powerful, stable motion. In this lesson you will see how that movement brought about a more dynamic pattern for Jeremy. He went from swipey weak push fades and pulls to strong push draws. If you are looking how to hit golf ball farther, this episode could be very helpful. title: Learn The INFINITY Swing To Stand It Up Then Shallow It Out!
description:
It's time to learn the INFINITY swing! In this video, Milo and Henry show you how to stand the club up in the backswing then shallow out in transition. This figure 8 golf swing drill will especially help those of you that tend to get steep and swing over the top. And if you are prone to slices and pulls, this could be the solution. By standing the club up in the backswing with good wrist conditions and working into lead side bend, we can then bounce into the downswing with less effort with the club staying up and back for a more in to out club path. Say hello to draws! While this drill isn't for everyone, it can provide a dramatic exaggeration to bring about a new pattern. We hope you enjoy this addition to the channel!

title: How To Dynamically LOWER The Arms In The Downswing
description:
There are some different trains of thought out there on how the arms lower in the downswing. In this video, I'd like to share my understanding of this movement and why I have the preferences I do. There are undoubtedly endless ways to move, match up, and swing the golf club, but if you have followed my channel you will know I like to move in a baseball hitting-like pattern, with rotation and flexion, a pattern I tend to see in the most powerful players. In this video I also incorporate some findings of Dr. Mark Bull @bull3dgolfacademy56 which I believe further demonstrate my preference that the arms do not fire down (and lower independently) from the top, but rather work slightly into us as we begin to unwind and flex leaving the club up and back. This produces a later firing of the arms and the club into the ball. As in most anything in life, there are various beliefs, interpretations of data, and how people convey their findings. I will continue to share my preferences with you here, preferences that I believe the most dynamic ball strikers embody in their golf swings. I hope you enjoy this video and thanks for following along!

title: Shallowing The Golf Club Made SIMPLE! (Shaft 90 Degrees To Your Spine)
description:
Let's look at a matchup I see amongst many of the great ball strikers throughout history, the shaft 90 degrees to the spine in the downswing. Fellow Milo Lines Golf coach, Ed Lasater joins me to show you this awesome matchup! This simple concept can help us in shallowing the golf club and in turn delivering the club through more of a rotational golf swing. This move can be natural if you allow the center of mass to kick back in transition. For many this never happens because they pull down, throw, and drop their arms from the top. We also look at the swings of Jon Rahm and Matthew Wolff to show how different backswing patterns can still produce a similar look in the downswing. Stop adding the energy early and learn to land and turn as shown in the video to get the club following you from behind into the ball. We hope you enjoy this video!

title: Make The Club LIGHT In The Backswing And HEAVY In Transition!
description:
In this video we'll show you how to make the club light in the backswing and heavy in transition for a more flowing golf swing! Henry and I will walk you through this simple concept to help you naturally slot the club. For many of you, the club gets behind early because of poor wrist conditions and little to no left side bend. This makes the club heavy early and often results in an over the top downswing. Conversely, we'll show you the opposite pattern, one where we make the shaft more vertical in the golf swing takeaway and backswing and make the golf club light. From there, much like tipping a baseball bat and the barrel falling back (shallowing), the club can fall into the slot with much less effort in transition coupled with your unwind. And for you senior golfers out there, this one concept could be especially helpful to your senior golf swing. We hope you enjoy this episode!

title: How To SHALLOW The Club And TURN Without Spinning Over The Top
description:
Have you been told that in order to shallow the club in the golf swing you must lower your arms before you can turn? Have you been told that early rotation will only make you steep? There are undoubtedly numerous ways and methods on how to shallow the club in transition, but I've lately seen many fellow coaches say that rotation is strictly producing a steep golf swing and causing golfers to spin over the top. They say the answer is to keep your back turned to the target and lower the arms to start the downswing. While I agree a certain type of rotation can create havoc and act as a swing steepener, this is not how I turn! And my preferences on shallowing the golf club in fact include rotation. I'll break down these different opinions and matchups, then with the help of Gears Sports 3D data, offer video breakdown of the transition movements captured from the swings of Rory McIlroy, Dustin Johnson, Sergio Garcia, and myself. And wouldn't you guess, we all do a same key move in transition that allows us to turn and unwind freely in our downswings, uninhibited, and with no over the top pattern. I hope you enjoy this video on creating a shallow golf swing with turn, and please let me know your thoughts below. Your feedback is appreciated!

title: DELAY Your Strike For A Powerful Golf Impact! (3 Keys)
description:
He, or she, who hits it latest hits it greatest! Are you looking for a more powerful golf swing and golf impact? In this video, fellow Milo Lines Golf Coach, Henry Fall and I demonstrate 3 keys for how to delay the strike and have the ball sizzle off the club face. For those of you that hit it too high and lose distance because of too much loft and low clubhead speed at impact, you'll learn how to deloft irons, reduce your dynamic loft, and have the golf ball exit out instead of up. Not only will your launch angle, contact, and dispersion improve, but you will hit it farther as well. Maybe you have long wondered how the pros make it look so effortless, yet hit it so far? This may be the video that answers that question for you. Stick around until the end to also pick up a new golf swing drill to add to your repertoire, the buggy whip drill. We hope you enjoy!

description:

title: How To Create An Inside Delivery With Rotation (Master The HITTING ZONE)
description:
Are you looking to create a more inside delivery through rotation? We kick off 2023 by returning to my roots, baseball! In this video, Henry and I uncover how you can better master the hitting zone, by looking at how elite hitters (both in golf and baseball) energize the delivery, and get the golf club or barrel to shallow as they turn through for a more dynamic impact position and swing path. As in golf, there are different philosophies on the baseball swing. From afar, there appears to be two primary approaches, one with a more straight line approach, and two where the bat lays down first behind the hitter. In this video, like always, I'll uncover my preferences and we'll look at legendary hitters like Aaron Judge, Ted Williams, Alex Rodriguez, and Albert Pujols for inspiration. Please note that I don't pretend or claim to be a baseball hitting coach, but I see similar athletic movements in both sports and believe the swings are more alike than not. We hope you enjoy this video and please do leave a comment below with your thoughts.

title: STOP Pulling Golf Shots And Learn To Hit Rotary Push DRAWS!
description:
One of my favorite shots and patterns to create with my students is a nice push draw. For many, learning how to hit a draw would be extremely beneficial, especially if you are tired of pulling golf shots. I'm so often used to seeing slices and pulls, that a push draw can be more than just a shot shape, it can act as a golf swing cure as well. Now, there can be numerous ways to create that draw pattern, but in this video Henry and I will be showing you our preferred method, where we still employ a more stable club face, rotational golf swing method to impart the curve we want. We simply alter our alignment at setup to produce the desired club face and swing path relationship, then employ the rotary golf swing. We also take a look at the Tommy Fleetwood golf swing and how he makes this push draw seem so effortless. We hope you enjoy this video, and let's get drawing!

title: COVER The Golf Ball And Hit Down With Your Irons (Wrist Extension SECRET)
description:
Let's further examine one of the key traits of my swing philosophy, trail wrist extension, and why it is so crucial for those of you looking to properly cover the golf ball. Maybe you keep telling yourself, I just need to hit down on the golf ball more, or I am not hitting down on golf ball correctly because my weight isn't enough on my left side, or I need to keep my head down? What if I told you one of the main reasons you likely aren't compressing the golf ball and creating the downward angle of attack you desire is because your hands and wrists simply aren't operating in a dynamic way. In this video, fellow Milo Lines Golf academy coach, Ed Lasater from San Diego and I walk you through this key delivery angle I see amongst the games best and you've likely seen me stress numerous times on this channel. Better impact and shaft lean await, I hope you enjoy!

title: The EXACT Golf Ball Position You Need To Pivot (Stance Placement That WORKS!)
description:
If you are looking to get a more open impact position, keep in mind your golf ball position as it could be restricting your pivot through the shot! In this video, Henry and I explore a common flaw we find with amateur golfers having their golf ball placement too far back in their stance. This can limit our turn and rotation and result in more of a stall, extend and flip/scoop at the ball. We'll show you the correct way to align the ball in your stance for a more rotational golf swing. We hope you enjoy!

title: The REVERSE SLOT Swing (Inside Takeaway To On Plane Downswing Like The Legends)
description:
How did so many of the legends of old and modern players use a reverse slot swing without coming over the top? In this video, Henry and I will walk you through this common pattern and why the distinction needs to be made between hand path and club path throughout the motion. We look at the swings of Sam Snead, Bobby Jones, Matt Fitzpatrick, and Bruce Lietzke to name a few reverse slot swingers, coined by one of my mentors, Jim McLean. Is their backswing takeaway truly inside and is the downswing truly over the top? Let's take a look and maybe this could be a light bulb moment for you at home as to why you get steep even with good body turn and hand path!

title: How To Keep Your Head Down And Stay In The Shot (Do This For COMPRESSION)
description:
Have you been told to keep your head down? I would guess you have, but have you also been told to keep you head out? In this video, Henry and I take a look at head movement in the golf swing and why keeping your head down may not be the best idea, especially for working your way through the shot from impact on. That being said, when it comes to keeping your head out over the ball, that can be crucial to staying in the shot and not backing up out of it. For those that struggle with early extension, heel and/or toe strikes, and standing up at impact, this could be a lightbulb watch. We hope you enjoy!

title: Rotate Into Your Left Arm And CATAPULT It Off! (Converting Adduction)
description:
Let's learn to catapult! In this video I walk you through the left arm action in the golf swing, specifically converting adduction.

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *Milo's 5 KEYS to a Rotational Golf Swing: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

Adduction of the arm is defined as the movement of the arm toward the midline of your body. In the golf swing transition, I like to see the lead arm move in towards the chest slightly more. This change in direction causes the center of mass or club head to then stay back. From here we can rotate back into the ball without coming over the top. Most great players, for example in the Dustin Johnson golf swing have this subtle move in their swing, and I even look at one of the competitors in the recent USGA Adaptive Open as he was an inspiration for this video. I hope you enjoy!

title: STOP Straightening Your Legs To Start The Downswing (BEND The Knees!)
description:
In today's video we are going to look at how bending your knees in the downswing can create a more powerful move. When we look at many athletic movements, knee flex is a common trait for using the ground and setting the stage to release the energy. Flex to square is a phrase you will hear me use from time-to-time. Look at the greats, Jack Nicklaus, Sam Snead, and others and you will see this common move early in the downswing. Let's head to the gym and look at this key move and some exercises you can do at home to train this feel. I hope you enjoy this video!

title: 5 Fundamentals Every Beginner Golfer NEEDS For The Full Swing! (Step By Step)
description:
Whether you are looking for a golf swing for beginners or you, having been playing for many years, or are an advanced pro, these 5 fundamentals act as a reminder to the key ingredients you should focus on to master your full swing. In this video Henry and I take you on a step by step look into grip, setup, club face, impact, and athletic motion. These 5 fundamentals highlight what we think are necessary for a sound golf swing, and what the best in the world prioritize on a weekly basis. The golf swing can be a complicated movement, but if you can focus on these fundamentals, I bet you'll be on track to your best move. Perhaps these aren't as sophisticated as the Ben Hogan Five Lessons, but nonetheless we hope you enjoy this video!

title: HAND PATH In Golf Swing Explained! (Best Plane From Takeaway To Slot)
description:
Hand path explained! Henry and I look at how your hand path is dictated by numerous factors, including your anatomy. How we takeaway the golf club and get it back in the slot can be different for each person. Some take it inside and get it back on plane, some swing more up and down a single plane, and others take it outside and shallow it out more in the downswing. All have worked for the greats throughout history and we reference the swings of Sam Snead, Sergio Garcia and Bubba Watson to compare and contrast. We also take a look at our swings side-by-side, even hitting side-by-side to take a look at our different unique matchups where Henry has more of a single plane golf swing, where mine tracks more as a two plane. We hope you enjoy!

title: STOP Tilting And Start Bending For A Pain Free Downswing!
description:
If you struggle with lower back pain and are looking to move better, let's start bending and stop tilting for a pain free downswing!

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *Milo's 5 KEYS to a Rotational Golf Swing: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

In this video I walk you through how bend further up in the chain to reduce slide and tilt in the lower body. This is a key distinction in creating a more rotational golf swing versus getting stuck behind. Let's learn to how to start the golf downswing right as this will also help with sequence. title: John Daly Swing Trigger (STOMP And Compress For Powerful Sequence)
description:

title: Golf Lesson: Creating A STABLE Impact And Exit With A Strong Grip (LIVE)
description:
In this golf lesson with Cortland, we mainly addressed the matchups created by certain golf grips. In his case, creating a stable impact with a weak grip was challenging with the amount of bow in left wrist he was needing to produce shaft lean. This led to heel strikes, a few shanks, and high pulls with his wedges. After some coaxing, Henry and I were able to have Cortland experiment with a strong golf grip, specifically in the left hand. This immediately brought about a more stable, square club face and allowed us to then focus on better movement and creating more optimal dynamics for his swing. We pick up halfway through this lesson due to some audio issues which we apologize for. I hope you enjoy this lesson!

title: The Right Arm Move YOU NEED For A WIDE Takeaway Golf Swing!
description:
One great way to encourage a more pivot driven motion is to create a wide takeaway golf swing. Maybe you've noticed your right arm in golf swing gets over-folded and narrow in the backswing? This often is followed by throwing angles and extending the trail arm early in the downswing. For a more consistent and wider arc at the bottom, let's look for a little more width and constant radius in our swing while still adding in dynamic wrist hinge. Plus, width is great for those of you looking to shallow the club in transition. Hopefully this video which includes this simple right arm technique helps you do just that!

title: The Secret Matchup YOU NEED To Rotate! (Draw The Arms Fade The Body)
description:
Watch this video for a secret matchup to help you rotate in your swing...draw the arms and fade the body! If you follow my channel, you'll know I like to see a symmetrical turn with the correct bends. This helps us stay fairly centered and level in our swings versus sliding and tilting. The arm and wrist structure then needs to match this turn. By learning to sling the arms (in this case with a draw feel), we can then propel the clubhead in the right arc without even thinking about it. Hope you enjoy this video!

title: Pivot For A Proper Golf Follow Through And Finish (Like Hitting A Home Run!)
description:
WATCH FULL VIDEO & OTHER 8 KEYS HERE! ðŸ‘‰ https://milolinesgolf.com/watch-now-turning-your-baseball-swing-into-a-consistent-golf-swing-the-9-essentials/

In this video, Henry and I discuss how the pivot can help you not only achieve a more dynamic impact position, and finish your golf swing like a pro (with a proper golf follow through) by rotating and slinging the arms into position. There are some similarities we see in a baseball hitter's finish in that the rotation actually counters the bat and allows them to stay in balance (even though it may appear they aren't). It's just like hitting a home run! We further look at the similarities between the baseball swing and golf swing and how to make the switch in our recent masterclass, which you watch here: https://milolinesgolf.com/watch-now-turning-your-baseball-swing-into-a-consistent-golf-swing-the-9-essentials/.

title: Weight Shift And Pressure Shift Made EASY! (Ground Reaction Force w/ The Sheftic Board)
description:
Here's an all you need breakdown of weight shift and pressure shift in the golf swing! 

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *Milo's 5 KEYS to a Rotational Golf Swing: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

If you follow my channel, you'll know that I like to see pressure move, but not as much mass. Too much weight transfer in the golf swing can cause low point control issues and leads to excessive sliding and tilting. With proper stance and pressure shifts one can make best use of ground force reaction. It's important to also understand the difference between weight and pressure shifts and in this video, Henry and I will do just that. Normally I would use Swing Catalyst to show these traces, but here we used the nifty Sheftic Pressure Board (https://www.shefticpressureboard.com) to help demonstrate. Hope you enjoy!

title: How To Bow Left Wrist For A Shallow Downswing
description:
I get asked a lot, Milo how do I bow my left wrist like the PGA Tour pros? My answer is always that it may not be the best matchup. 

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

Players like Collin Morikawa, Jon Rahm, and Dustin Johnson have unique grips that allow them to achieve that bowed wrist position at the top of the backswing. When we start talking about wrist conditions, we need to first look at the grip and how our hands are aligned and holding the golf club. In this video, Henry and I discuss why we see bowing and flexing of the lead wrist in the golf swing and how this movement can create a more shallow downswing. Hope you enjoy!

title: This Is Causing Your BACK PAIN In The Golf Swing! (w/ Dr. Luke Bracke)
description:
My good friend and fellow golf coach (plus anesthesiologist), Dr. Luke Bracke, joins me to cover the 3 main causes of back pain in the golf swing, and as you probably guessed, extension is involved in all of them. These findings came from a TPI golf article Luke had read years ago. As you likely saw in my recent videos, continuing with our series with Elite Golf Schools, Luke and I expand on our preference for flexion rotators over extended tilted golf swings (something Riley Andrews brought up). title: Seve Ballesteros Holster Move To Hit The Soft Flop Shot In Golf
description:
If you love short game and hitting the saucy, soft flop shot around the green, here's a technique from the great Seve Ballesteros you'll want to try...the holster move! For high shots with lots of backspin this can be super fun. Seve was known for his great hands, incredible touch and legendary golf trick shots. He was sought after for his secrets (even from the likes of Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson). If there was ever a Seve exhibition on short game, you'd want to be there! Here's our take on a move he often used around the green where the handle of the golf club seemingly fell into his left pocket in the finish. Hope you enjoy!

title: Learn Push And Pull SPIRAL For Ground Force Reaction (Lawnmower Drill)
description:
In this video, you'll learn to properly spiral (push and pull) in the golf swing through better use of ground force reaction. With the help of resistance bands, you can replicate the same movements felt in the golf swing. Create a deeper backswing, then unwind it in the downswing. In this case, we incorporate a classic golf exercise known as the lawnmower drill with a little twist. This movement can help you feel how to pressure the ground not just in a linear fashion, but also down, towards, and away from the golf ball to help set up that rotational spiral action! As you'll see, this push and pull is not solely an upper body and arm driven exercise.

title: ROTATE With These Golf Swing Drills | Tour Rotation Stick Training Aid
description:
Get your own Tour Rotation Stick (TRS) for 10% OFF HERE: https://milolinesgolf.com/training-gear/

The Tour Rotation Stick is one of a few training aids I use on a consistent basis with my students. It provides wonderful (immediate) feedback, most notably through the hitting area and impact when we are looking to have some shaft lean and learn how to rotate better. There are several other awesome golf swing drills you can do with the TRS, including: club in front of the hands in takeaway, trace the line, and stand the club up to shallow it out in transition. 

It's an awesome multipurpose tool and training aid you can practice with on the driving range or away from the golf course in your own home, perfect for developing a more pivot driven golf swing. Henry was first introduced to the TRS several years ago through the founder, Liam Bond, an excellent European Tour golf coach and former professional golfer himself. Since partnering, the TRS has been seen in the hands of Tommy Fleetwood, Robert Rock, and numerous other well-known players from across the pond. When Henry is out on the road caddying for his girlfriend, Dana Finkelstein, on the LPGA Tour, he always has a TRS on hand, and it's a tool we have used with Dana before to practice the exact exercises seen in this video. The TRS has become a staple tool for our coaching and our online academy! You can receive 10% OFF a TRS on my website: https://milolinesgolf.com/training-gear/

title: Create Effortless Hip Hinge And Turn With These SIMPLE Techniques! (Weird But WORKS!)
description:
Let's look at how we can develop a more rotary swing with proper hip hinge and turn by training with resistance and assistance. One key aspect of learning and training new movements is how we feel changes. In this video, Henry and I look at whether it's better for you to resist or assist a desired golf swing change. You'll see us use various resistance band workouts in this video to demonstrate. When we workout at the gym, we are typically training our muscles to work through a resisted movement to gain strength, speed, and perhaps range of motion. However, when first mastering a new movement, it can be invaluable to use a lighter weight or be assisted by a coach or machine to establish good form. So as you will see in this video, both of these methods have a place. Whether you struggle with early extension and standing up in golf swing, poor golf posture, or struggle to rotate, experiment for yourself and comment below with which method has provided the best learning for you! Thanks for watching.

title: PUTTING TIPS To Make That Left To Right Putt (Pressure And Lie Angle)
description:
Watch this video for secret putting tips covering the dreaded left to right putt. One of the most difficult putts to make and start on line is undoubtedly those sneaky left to right breaking putts (for us right-handed golfers)! Could there be a trick to putting a better stroke on the ball, for once, not missing on the low side? Henry and I look at how some of the greatest putters used a change in pressure and lie angle to better attack these putts. Tiger Woods has made some meaningful left-to-righters when it mattered most, and you can tell he's employed some of the keys we will cover in this video. Enjoy!

title: How To Hit Driver Farther Than Ever (Head Back And Down For BOMBS!)
description:
Looking how to hit driver father than ever and hit bombs? Take a look at what your upper center is doing, and in specific, your head. Is it staying back? Does it move like the greats and longest hitters today? Many of you may also be wondering how to hit up on driver and launch the ball with low spin, well this head movement can also play a part. We also take a look at a few of the longest drivers in today's game, Bryson DeChambeau, Rory McIlroy, and Kyle Berkshire and how they move their upper centers to create optimal launch conditions. We hope you enjoy!

title: Could This Tiger Woods Swing Feel Be The Secret?
description:
In this wild, viral video of Tiger Woods in 2019, Tiger made an extreme exaggeration to transition his golf swing and begin his downswing. 

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *Milo's 5 KEYS to a Rotational Golf Swing: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

Warming up before the final round at Memorial, Tiger was making some unusual looking rehearsals! These would help him mitigate against early extension and pain on his back (a big key and perhaps secret to his comeback). Many a hall of fame members have a similar move seen in their golf swing. Henry and I walk you through this crazy Tiger Woods swing feel from perhaps the greatest player of all time, fresh off his 2019 Masters win! Even in 2022 this appears to be Tiger's go to drill. Hope you enjoy.

title: How To Hold A Golf Club (Perfect Strong Grip To Swing Like An Athlete!)
description:
Are you looking for a more dynamic way on how to hold a golf club? 

*Get swing analysis every 2 weeks + Miloâ€™s full swing playbook HERE ðŸ‘‰ https://swinglikeanathlete.com*

In this video, I take you step-by-step through my method for gripping the golf club like an athlete. You will see in this video that I employ and typically encourage a strong grip, especially in the (lead) left hand. I believe this positions the left wrist in its most optimal position for movement and strike, while also reducing the risk of injury. 

The grip is our only connection to the golf club and for that reason a key foundation on my online academy, and in my coaching. A sound grip can quickly remedy a wicked slice or vice versa a duck hook. While there are countless ways to grip the club (as outlined in this video), this is my preferred method. Please do leave a comment below describing your grip and thoughts on my method. I hope you enjoy!

title: Create Effortless LAG In Golf Swing With This Key Matchup! (Live Golf Lesson @BEBETTERGOLF)
description:
Many of you are wondering how to lag the golf club, but the question is, how do we produce lag in the downswing naturally and passively, versus actively pulling down (narrowing) or physically holding angles? I like to see the lag happen as a byproduct of sound rotational and athletic movement. Maybe you are looking for that Sergio Garcia lag, but perhaps that's not best for everyone. In this video recorded earlier this year with Brendon (BE BETTER GOLF), we look at the key matchup in the golf swing I see across numerous other stick and ball sports: the parallel lines. Thanks to SilverRock Resort in La Quinta, California. And head over to Brendon's YouTube Channel, BE BETTER GOLF to see our other collaborations: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLK1sbUjAAin55zCgF0UNz7tA6VIeAZT34

description:

title: Hip Turn And Depth W/ Simple Golf Swing Drill | STOP Early Extending
description:
Early extension is a prominent issue for most golfers. Thrusting the hips towards the golf ball can lead to a lack of space, loss of spine angle, and numerous mishits (including chunks and thin shots). In this video, Henry and I show you a golf swing drill using a golf alignment stick to help you create and maintain some depth and space as you return for impact. Get the hips and rear end back and turning the corner versus moving into the ball! I hope you enjoy!

title: Hip Rotation In Golf Swing Without Spinning Out (BELT BUCKLE Down And Round)
description:
I get asked all the time, "How do I rotate early in my downswing without spinning out?". We've got the answer!

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *Milo's 5 KEYS to a Rotational Golf Swing: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

Well, hopefully this video will shed some light on what I like to see happen. The belt buckle can be a great indicator of what is going on in the golf swing, especially in transition with the hips. Does the belt buckle move up, level, or down? Does it move away from the ball, stay the same distance, or move closer? These are questions we cover in this video, and if you are an Anthony Kim fan, we've got you covered! We also introduce an effective drill and test you can do at home or on the driving range to help train this key movement for proper hip rotation in golf swing. I hope you enjoy!

title: Turn Ground Force Into Rotation | Reflex In Golf Swing Like A BOARDER | Athletics Series
description:
So maybe you have a boarding background yourself, say: skateboarding, snowboarding, surfing, etc? Maybe some of the movements seen in these sports could actually be similar to those in the golf swing? In this video, fellow Milo Lines Academy coach, Henry Fall and I take a look at how these boarders use their lower body to propel themselves into seemingly effortless rotation. We discuss reflexing, squatting, ground force, rotation, and upper body similarities and differences. Let us know your thoughts in the comments below. We hope you enjoy!

title: Circle The Left Knee For PROPER Leg Action And Golf Hip Turn!
description:
Let's circle the left knee (moving out and around) as we change directions in the golf swing! Proper leg action and golf hip turn awaits.

ðŸ”‘ðŸŒªï¸ *Milo's 5 KEYS to a Rotational Golf Swing: https://milolinesgolf.com/5-keys-to-unlocking-a-rotational-golf-swing/*

By properly using the legs in the golf swing, this action will set up rotation keep our left hip inside our ankle (a topic you have seen me cover before to cure sway and slide). As I work into the golf downswing, I like to feel as though my knees flex and widen out with the pressure falling into my left foot. Maybe you've also seen my Sam Snead squat videos on this topic? Watch the whole video as we discuss a couple parts that run in tandem with this subject. Enjoy!

title: Easy Swing For Bad Back | Lesson With John G (Alternative Method Perfect For Senior Golfers!)
description:
Not all lessons are alike, and not all students are alike. As a coach, I have my preferences for the golf swing and the way someone ought to move (as laid out in most of the videos on this channel), however at the end of the day I coach the individual, not the method. With John G here, it was quickly evident that his back was not allowing him to perform certain movements the day of our lesson together. In our past lessons, the more rotational driven swing had worked well for him, but as you will see in this video, he was just not able to make that happen on this day with how badly his back was bothering him. I've also made a few videos in the past on the various ways to swing a golf club, and for John we went with one of these alternative approaches, one of freely elevating the club and letting gravity bring it back down. It seems simple, but it can really work if your body just isn't allowing other movements. This can also be a great swing for senior golfers!

title: Head Movement In Golf Swing (Keep Your Head Down Or Swivel It Open?)
description:
In this video, Henry and I chat about head movement in golf swing, specifically how it moves through the hitting area amongst the game's best. We separate these styles into 2 ways. Some keep the head down (or "stay in the shot"), and others let their heads swivel open.

We'll look at a few PGA Tour and LPGA Tour golfers that exemplify both movements, including: David Duval, Annika Sorenstam, Dustin Johnson, Henrik Stenson, Tiger Woods, Jack Nicklaus, and Mac O'Grady. Eye dominance may play a part! So the question is, should YOU keep your head down in the golf swing or let it swivel open?

title: Don't Do This With Your Left Wrist At Impact! (90% Of Golfers Are Told Otherwise)
description:
In this video, Henry and I will show you how to safely return your left wrist at impact. This may be one of the most important videos we've ever put on YouTube! It's been said you should bow the left wrist towards the target at impact (flat wrist) and drive the handle to the target, but is this a necessity and does it align with your golf grip? Many of today's best golfers in fact are not pointing their glove logos towards the target in their impact position, but why is that? I hope you enjoy this important conversation and maybe it can help you maintain a pain free golf swing!

title: Rotate With Right Wrist Extension (Set The Angle!) | Milo Lines Golf
description:
One of my main teachings is the role of the (trail) right wrist in the golf swing. Learn to use wrist extension and set the angle!

â›½ï¸ðŸ”¥ *Miloâ€™s Favorite Drill to COMPRESS the Golf Ball: https://milolinesgolf.com/compress*

It is my belief that the trail wrist should primarily work to extend prior to and into impact. This can help in setting up the rotation, once one knows to simply turn out of the way to square up the club face. Perhaps you have been told in the past to hinge (radial) your wrists or roll your wrists, but to me, this is the way I like to see the trail wrist operate in the golf swing.
